1.0: She became married to him in the sitva: The days of the winter.

2.0: They would sleep in a straw storehouse: They would sleep amidst the straw, since they did not have pillows and covers.
2.1: He would gather straw from mazeyah: He would pluck the straw from his hair.
2.2: If I had [it], I would crown you [with a] Jerusalem of Gold: If I will have the means - such that I become wealthy - I will make you a Jerusalem of Gold, a necklace (choker) decorated with all matters of Jerusalem. And that is that which we say in Tractate Shabbat (59a), "A City of Jerusalem of Gold, like Rabbi Akiva made for his wife."
2.3: Elijah came calling on the door, etc.:. He did this for the sake of their satisfaction - that he did not even have straw like they had.

3.0: Your father behaved well toward you: That he vowed against you [inheriting] his property.
3.1: One [reason is] that he is not similar to you: As he is inferior to you. And also, he has left you in living widowhood - since behold, he has left you several years.

4.0: A righteous one knows the life of his beast: Some say that she knew that it was Rabbi Akiva, so she said to [the wicked man] that she would not be disgraceful in his eyes. And some say that she did not know, but this is what she said - that a righteous one will not disgrace people.
4.1: Mine and yours are hers: Everything that I learned is on her account.
